name: PublisherClient
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
V1
PublisherClient
description: The service that an application uses to manipulate topics, and to send messages to a topic.

methods.name: topic_path
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
V1
PublisherClient.topic_path
methods.description: Returns a fully-qualified topic resource name string.

methods.name: project_path
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
V1
PublisherClient.project_path
methods.description: Returns a fully-qualified project resource name string.

params.name: credentials
params.description: Provides the means for authenticating requests made by the client. This parameter can be many types. A Google::Auth::Credentials uses a the properties of its represented keyfile for authenticating requests made by this client. A String will be treated as the path to the keyfile to be used for the construction of credentials for this client. A Hash will be treated as the contents of a keyfile to be used for the construction of credentials for this client. A GRPC::Core::Channel will be used to make calls through. A GRPC::Core::ChannelCredentials for the setting up the RPC client. The channel credentials should already be composed with a GRPC::Core::CallCredentials object. A Proc will be used as an updater_proc for the Grpc channel. The proc transforms the metadata for requests, generally, to give OAuth credentials.

params.name: scopes
params.description:
The OAuth scopes for this service. This parameter is ignored if
an updater_proc is supplied.

params.name: client_config
params.description:
A Hash for call options for each method. See
Google::Gax#construct_settings for the structure of
this data. Falls back to the default config if not specified
or the specified config is missing data points.

params.name: timeout
params.description: The default timeout, in seconds, for calls made through this client.

params.name: metadata
params.description: Default metadata to be sent with each request. This can be overridden on a per call basis.

params.name: exception_transformer
params.description:
An optional proc that intercepts any exceptions raised during an API call to inject
custom error handling.

methods.name: create_topic
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
V1
PublisherClient#create_topic
methods.description: Creates the given topic with the given name. See the resource name rules.

params.name: name
params.description:
The name of the topic. It must have the format
+”projects/{project}/topics/{topic}”+. +{topic}+ must start with a letter,
and contain only letters (+[A-Za-z]+), numbers (+[0-9]+), dashes (+-+),
underscores (+_+), periods (+.+), tildes (+~+), plus (+++) or percent
signs (+%+). It must be between 3 and 255 characters in length, and it
must not start with +”goog”+.

params.name: labels
params.description: User labels.

params.name: message_storage_policy
params.description: Policy constraining how messages published to the topic may be stored. It is determined when the topic is created based on the policy configured at the project level. It must not be set by the caller in the request to CreateTopic or to UpdateTopic. This field will be populated in the responses for GetTopic, CreateTopic, and UpdateTopic: if not present in the response, then no constraints are in effect. A hash of the same form as Google::Pubsub::V1::MessageStoragePolicy can also be provided.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

methods.name: update_topic
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
V1
PublisherClient#update_topic
methods.description: Updates an existing topic. Note that certain properties of a topic are not modifiable.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

publisher_client = Google::Cloud::Pubsub::Publisher.new(version: :v1)

# TODO: Initialize +topic+:
topic = {}

# TODO: Initialize +update_mask+:
update_mask = {}
response = publisher_client.update_topic(topic, update_mask)

params.name: topic
params.description: The updated topic object. A hash of the same form as Google::Pubsub::V1::Topic can also be provided.

params.name: update_mask
params.description: Indicates which fields in the provided topic to update. Must be specified and non-empty. Note that if +update_mask+ contains “message_storage_policy” then the new value will be determined based on the policy configured at the project or organization level. The +message_storage_policy+ must not be set in the +topic+ provided above. A hash of the same form as Google::Protobuf::FieldMask can also be provided.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

methods.name: publish
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
V1
PublisherClient#publish
methods.description: Adds one or more messages to the topic. Returns +NOT_FOUND+ if the topic does not exist. The message payload must not be empty; it must contain either a non-empty data field, or at least one attribute.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

publisher_client = Google::Cloud::Pubsub::Publisher.new(version: :v1)
formatted_topic = Google::Cloud::Pubsub::V1::PublisherClient.topic_path("[PROJECT]", "[TOPIC]")
data = ''
messages_element = { data: data }
messages = [messages_element]
response = publisher_client.publish(formatted_topic, messages)

params.name: topic
params.description:
The messages in the request will be published on this topic.
Format is +projects/{project}/topics/{topic}+.

params.name: messages
params.description: The messages to publish. A hash of the same form as Google::Pubsub::V1::PubsubMessage can also be provided.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

params.name: topic
params.description:
The name of the topic to get.
Format is +projects/{project}/topics/{topic}+.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

publisher_client = Google::Cloud::Pubsub::Publisher.new(version: :v1)
formatted_project = Google::Cloud::Pubsub::V1::PublisherClient.project_path("[PROJECT]")

# Iterate over all results.
publisher_client.list_topics(formatted_project).each do |element|
  # Process element.
end

# Or iterate over results one page at a time.
publisher_client.list_topics(formatted_project).each_page do |page|
  # Process each page at a time.
  page.each do |element|
    # Process element.
  end
end

params.name: project
params.description:
The name of the cloud project that topics belong to.
Format is +projects/{project}+.

params.name: page_size
params.description:
The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API
response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this
parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is
performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of
resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

returns.description:
An enumerable of Google::Pubsub::V1::Topic instances.
See Google::Gax::PagedEnumerable documentation for other
operations such as per-page iteration or access to the response
object.

methods.name: list_topic_subscriptions
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
V1
PublisherClient#list_topic_subscriptions
methods.description: Lists the names of the subscriptions on this topic.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

publisher_client = Google::Cloud::Pubsub::Publisher.new(version: :v1)
formatted_topic = Google::Cloud::Pubsub::V1::PublisherClient.topic_path("[PROJECT]", "[TOPIC]")

# Iterate over all results.
publisher_client.list_topic_subscriptions(formatted_topic).each do |element|
  # Process element.
end

# Or iterate over results one page at a time.
publisher_client.list_topic_subscriptions(formatted_topic).each_page do |page|
  # Process each page at a time.
  page.each do |element|
    # Process element.
  end
end

params.name: topic
params.description:
The name of the topic that subscriptions are attached to.
Format is +projects/{project}/topics/{topic}+.

params.name: page_size
params.description:
The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API
response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this
parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is
performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of
resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

returns.description:
An enumerable of String instances.
See Google::Gax::PagedEnumerable documentation for other
operations such as per-page iteration or access to the response
object.

methods.name: delete_topic
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
V1
PublisherClient#delete_topic
methods.description: Deletes the topic with the given name. Returns +NOT_FOUND+ if the topic does not exist. After a topic is deleted, a new topic may be created with the same name; this is an entirely new topic with none of the old configuration or subscriptions. Existing subscriptions to this topic are not deleted, but their +topic+ field is set to +deleted-topic+.

params.name: topic
params.description:
Name of the topic to delete.
Format is +projects/{project}/topics/{topic}+.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

methods.name: set_iam_policy
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
V1
PublisherClient#set_iam_policy
methods.description: Sets the access control policy on the specified resource. Replaces any existing policy.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

publisher_client = Google::Cloud::Pubsub::Publisher.new(version: :v1)
formatted_resource = Google::Cloud::Pubsub::V1::PublisherClient.topic_path("[PROJECT]", "[TOPIC]")

# TODO: Initialize +policy+:
policy = {}
response = publisher_client.set_iam_policy(formatted_resource, policy)

params.name: resource
params.description:
REQUIRED: The resource for which the policy is being specified.
+resource+ is usually specified as a path. For example, a Project
resource is specified as +projects/{project}+.

params.name: policy
params.description: REQUIRED: The complete policy to be applied to the +resource+. The size of the policy is limited to a few 10s of KB. An empty policy is a valid policy but certain Cloud Platform services (such as Projects) might reject them. A hash of the same form as Google::Iam::V1::Policy can also be provided.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

methods.name: get_iam_policy
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
V1
PublisherClient#get_iam_policy
methods.description: Gets the access control policy for a resource. Returns an empty policy if the resource exists and does not have a policy set.

params.name: resource
params.description:
REQUIRED: The resource for which the policy is being requested.
+resource+ is usually specified as a path. For example, a Project
resource is specified as +projects/{project}+.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

methods.name: test_iam_permissions
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
V1
PublisherClient#test_iam_permissions
methods.description: Returns permissions that a caller has on the specified resource. If the resource does not exist, this will return an empty set of permissions, not a NOT_FOUND error.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

publisher_client = Google::Cloud::Pubsub::Publisher.new(version: :v1)
formatted_resource = Google::Cloud::Pubsub::V1::PublisherClient.topic_path("[PROJECT]", "[TOPIC]")

# TODO: Initialize +permissions+:
permissions = []
response = publisher_client.test_iam_permissions(formatted_resource, permissions)

params.name: resource
params.description:
REQUIRED: The resource for which the policy detail is being requested.
+resource+ is usually specified as a path. For example, a Project
resource is specified as +projects/{project}+.

params.name: permissions
params.description: The set of permissions to check for the +resource+. Permissions with wildcards (such as ‘’ or ‘storage.’) are not allowed. For more information see IAM Overview.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation
